gurmukhi: ਦੇਸ ਦੇਸ ਬੁਲਾੲਿ ਕੈ ਬਹੁ ਭਾਂਤ ਭਾਂਤ ਨ੍ਰਿਪਾਲ ||
transliteration: Des Des Bulaae Kai Bahu Bhaant Bhaant Nripaal||
translation: Various types of kings from various countries were called.

gurmukhi: ਭਾਂਤ ਭਾਂਤਨ ਕੋ ਦੀੲੇ ਬਹੁ ਦਾਨ ਮਾਨ ਰਸਾਲ ||
transliteration: Bhaant Bhaantan Ko Deee Bahu Daan Maan Rasaal||
translation: They were given many gifts of various types with honour,

gurmukhi: ਹੀਰ ਚੀਰ ਪਟੰਬਰਾਦਿਕ ਬਾਜ ਅੳੁ ਗਜਰਾਜ ||
transliteration: Heer Cheer Patanbraadik Baaj Au Gadraaj||
translation: Including diamonds, silken clothers etc., horses and big elephants.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਜ ਸਾਜ ਸਭੈ ਦੀੲੇ ਬਹੁ ਰਾਜ ਕੋ ਨ੍ਰਿਪਰਾਜ ||੩||੧੫੯||
transliteration: Saaj Saaj Sabhai Deee Bahu Raaj Ko Nripraaj||3||159||
translation: The great Sovereign gave all the things highly decorated to the kings.3.159.

gurmukhi: ਅੈਸਿ ਭਾਂਤ ਕੀਓ ਤਹਾਂ ਬਹੁ ਬਰਖ ਲੳੁ ਤਿਹ ਰਾਜ ||
transliteration: Aees(i) Bhaant Keeo Tahaan Bahu Barakh Lau Tih Raaj||
translation: In this way he ruled there for many years.

gurmukhi: ਕਰਨ ਦੇਵ ਪ੍ਰਮਾਨ ਲੳੁ ਅਰ ਜੀਤ ਕੈ ਬਹੁ ਸਾਜ ||
transliteration: Karan Dev Pramaan Lau Ar Jeet Kai Bahu Saaj||
translation: Many eminent enemies like the king Karan were conquered alongwith many of their precious belongings.

gurmukhi: ੲੇਕ ਦਿਵਸ ਚੜ੍ਹਿਓ ਨ੍ਰਿਪ ਬਰ ਸੈਲ ਕਾਜ ਅਖੇਟ ||
transliteration: Ej Divas Chadhio Nrip Bar Sail Kaaj Akhet||
translation: On one day the king went on a merry-making trip and hunting.

gurmukhi: ਦੇਖ ਮ੍ਰਿਗ ਭੲਿਓ ਤਹਾਂ ਮੁਨ ਰਾਜ ਸਿੳੁ ਭੲੀ ਭੇਟ ||੪||੧੬੦||
transliteration: Dekh Mrig Bhaio Tahaan Mounndraaj Sio Bhaibhet||4||160||
translation: He saw and pursued a deer and met a great sage.4.160.

gurmukhi: ਪੈਡ ਯਾਹਿ ਗੲਿਓ ਨਹੀਂ ਮ੍ਰਿਗ ਰੇ ਰਖੀਸਰ ਬੋਲ ||
transliteration: Paid Yaah(i) Gado Naheenmrig Re Rakheesar Bol||
translation: (He said to the sage) “O great sage ! Please speak, did the deer go this way ?”

gurmukhi: ੳੁਤ੍ਰ ਭੂਪਹਿ ਨਾ ਦੀਓ ਮੁਨਿ ਅਾਂਖਿ ਭੀ ੲਿਕ ਖੋਲ ||
transliteration: Outra Bhoopah(i) Naa Deeo Mounndi) Aankh(i) Bhieek Dhol||
translation: The sage did not open his eye nor gave any answer to the king,

gurmukhi: ਮ੍ਰਿਤਕ ਸਰਪ ਨਿਹਾਰ ਕੈ ਜਿਹ ਅਗ੍ਰ ਤਾਹ ੳੁਠਾੲਿ ||
transliteration: Mritak Sarap Nihaar Kai Jih Agra Taah Outhaae||
translation: Seeing a dead snake, (the king) raised it with the tip of his bow;

gurmukhi: ਤੳੁਨ ਕੇ ਗਰ ਡਾਰ ਕੈ ਨ੍ਰਿਪ ਜਾਤ ਭਯੋ ਨ੍ਰਿਪਰਾੲਿ ||੫||੧੬੧||
transliteration: Taoun Ke Gad Daar Kai Nrip Jaat Bhayo Nripraae||5||161||
translation: Put it around the neck of the sage; then the Great Sovereign went away.5.161.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਂਖ ੳੁਘਾਰ ਲਖੈ ਕਹਾ ਮੁਨਿ ਸਰਪ ਦੇਖ ਡਰਾਨ ||
transliteration: Aankh Oughaar Lakhai Kahaa Mounndi) Sarap Dekh Daraan||
translation: What did the sage see on opening his eyes? He was frightened to see the snake (around his neck).

gurmukhi: ਕ੍ਰੋਪ ਕਰਤ ਭਯੋ ਤਹਾਂ ਦ??ਿਜ ਰਕਤ ਨੇਤ੍ਰ ਚੁਚਾਨ ||
transliteration: Krodh Karat Bhayo Tahaan Dvij Rakat Netra Chouchaan||
translation: There he became very angry and the blood oozed out form the eyes of the Brahmin.
